intro: Euphrasia officinalis var. imbricata, commonly known as the imbricata eyebright, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its medicinal properties have been historically valued for their purported benefits to eye health and respiratory conditions. The species is also noted for its ornamental value due to its delicate foliage and clusters of tiny flowers.
